snippet: A federal grand jury indicted two companies on involuntary manslaughter charges, and three people were also facing charges, in a 2012 explosion in the Gulf of Mexico, the Justice Department said.
abstract: Federal grand jury indicts two companies on involuntary manslaughter charges in 2012 explosion on oil platform owned by Black Elk Energy Offshore Operations in Gulf of Mexico; three individuals also face charges.
lead_paragraph: A federal grand jury indicted two companies on involuntary manslaughter charges, and three people were also facing charges, in a 2012 explosion in the Gulf of Mexico, the Justice Department said.

headline.print_headline: Two Companies Indicted in Deadly Oil Rig Explosion
headline.main: Two Companies Indicted in Deadly Oil Rig Explosion
